instruction: How were machine learning models utilized in the analysis of soil salinity using remote sensing satellite data in salt-affected land?
Output: In the analysis of soil salinity using remote sensing satellite data in salt-affected land, machine learning models, specifically the Random Forest model, were utilized. The models were trained and validated using collected soil samples' electrical conductivity values. 70% of the soil samples were used for model training, while the remaining 30% were used for validation. The machine learning models were used to assess the spectral indices of vegetation and soil salinity calculated from the satellite data. The models were able to compare the different spatial resolution satellite images (Sentinel-2 and Landsat-8) and determine the most suitable satellite image for assessing soil salinity. The overall accuracy of the models, assessed through 5-fold cross-validation, was found to be 98.31% for Sentinel-2 and 97.19% for Landsat-8. This analysis demonstrated the effectiveness of machine learning models in detecting salt-affected land and can aid in evaluating unproductive land and its management for the development of alternative livelihood options at the state or regional level.
